summary_gpt: Tata Motors Limited has approved the issuance of up to ₹500 crore in Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) through private placement, with details of the tranche structure, tenure, and listing on NSE disclosed. The NCDs will have a fixed coupon rate of 7.08% and are scheduled for allotment in May 2025, maturing in 2028.

Tata Motors Limited has approved the issuance of up to ₹500 crore in Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) through private placement, with details of the tranche structure, tenure, and listing on NSE disclosed. The NCDs are planned to be issued in two tranches with a fixed coupon rate of 7.08% and maturity in 2028.

Tata Motors reported a decline in total sales for April 2025, with domestic sales down 7% YoY and overall units sold at 72,753, reflecting a slight decrease in both commercial and passenger vehicle segments. The company provided detailed sales figures across various categories, including commercial vehicles and passenger vehicles, with some segments showing growth and others decline.

Tata Motors Limited has scheduled a meeting on May 2, 2025, to consider issuing up to ₹500 crore of rated, listed, unsecured, redeemable, non-convertible debentures via private placement. This indicates a potential move to raise debt capital for its operations or expansion.

The filing announces a scheduled investor and analyst conference call on May 13, 2025, to discuss Tata Motors' Q4FY25 financial results, including insights from senior management and Jaguar Land Rover executives. It provides details on the webcast access and participants involved in the discussion.

The filing informs about the change in contact details of MUFG Intime India Private Limited, the Registrar and Transfer Agent of Tata Motors Limited, including updated address and communication channels. It serves as an official notification for shareholders and stakeholders to update their records.
